Now for the reason we had come all the way
to Blagaj, that would be to visit Blagaj Tekija,

a Dervish monastery (Blagaj Tekke) which is
tucked under a cliff and sits by the source
of the Buna River.

The structure is believed to date back to
the 1520s and it contains elements of Ottoman

architecture and Mediterranean style, making
it a national monument.

So just looking over men must wear long trousers
under the knees.

But I think the main draw are the views you

the Buna River.
